alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 1:32PM MDT until May 28 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Colorado... Colorado River near CO-UT State Line affecting Grand and Mesa Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Colorado River near CO-UT State Line. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...at 10.0 ft, minor flooding is expected between Redlands and Loma. Sections of the Riverfront Pedestrian/Bike Trail become inundated with water between Fruita and Loma. Impacts...at 12.00 ft, low-land flooding is likely between the Redlands and Loma, multiple sections of the bike path along the Colorado River may be inundated and become impassable. Water levels approach bridge structures along I-70, between Fruita and Loma. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate near bankfull stage with a maximum value of 12.7 feet Sunday morning. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks, and please heed all trail and roadway closures. Water levels along the Colorado will continue to run high with fast flows and flooding in some areas. Please use caution if recreating on or camping near the river. High water often occurs at night and river conditions may change rapidly.
